verses.t: I will extol{H7311} Lordthee, O {H3068}; for thou hast lifted me up{H1802}, and hast not made my foes{H341} to rejoice{H8055} over me.
LordO {H3068} my God{H430}, I cried{H7768} unto thee, and thou hast healed{H7495} me.
LordO {H3068}, thou hast brought up{H5927} my soul{H5315} from the grave{H7585}: thou hast kept me alive{H2421}, that I should not go down{H3381} to the pit{H953}.
Sing{H2167} Lordunto the {H3068}, O ye saints{H2623} of his, and give thanks{H3034} at the remembrance{H2143} of his holiness{H6944}.at…: or, to the memorial

For his anger{H639} endureth but a moment{H7281}; in his favour{H7522} is life{H2416}: weeping{H1065} may endure{H3885} for a night{H6153}, but joy{H7440} cometh in the morning{H1242}.his anger…: Heb. there is but a moment in his angerfor a night: Heb. in the eveningjoy: Heb. singing
And in my prosperity{H7959} I said{H559}, I shall never{H5769} be moved{H4131}.

Lord, by thy favour{H7522} thou hast made my mountain{H2042} to stand{H5975} strong{H5797}: thou didst hide{H5641} thy face{H6440}, and I was troubled{H926}.made…: Heb. settled strength for my mountain
I cried{H7121} Lordto thee, O {H3068}; Lordand unto the {H3068} I made supplication{H2603}.
What profit{H1215} is there in my blood{H1818}, when I go down{H3381} to the pit{H7845}? Shall the dust{H6083} praise{H3034} thee? shall it declare{H5046} thy truth{H571}?
Hear{H8085}, LordO {H3068}, and have mercy{H2603} Lordupon me: {H3068}, be thou my helper{H5826}.
Thou hast turned{H2015} for me my mourning{H4553} into dancing{H4234}: thou hast put off{H6605} my sackcloth{H8242}, and girded{H247} me with gladness{H8057};

To the end that my glory{H3519} may sing{H2167} praise to thee, and not be silent{H1826}. LordO {H3068} my God{H430}, I will give thanks{H3034} unto thee for ever{H5769}.my glory: that is, my tongue, or, my soul
